Package dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.mobspawn

Class BaseMobSpawn

java.lang.Object
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.BaseEvent
dev.strwbry.eventhorizon.events.mobspawn.BaseMobSpawn
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChickenFlock, CowHerd, DropCreeper, EndRaid, NetherRaid, RandomMobSpawn, SubNetherRaid, SubSpawnIceMobs, WolfPack, ZombieHorde, ZombieInvasion
public abstract class BaseMobSpawn extends BaseEvent
Base class for implementing mob spawning events in Minecraft. This class provides comprehensive functionality for spawning mobs around players with various configurable parameters such as spawn radius, mob types, and spawning behavior. The class supports: - Single or continuous spawning - Group or spread spawning - Surface-only or 3D space spawning - Multiple mob types with random selection - Safe location detection for spawning
See Also:
  • BaseEvent
  • EventClassification

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseMobSpawn

      public BaseMobSpawn(EventClassification classification, String eventName)
      Constructs a mob spawn event with specified classification and name.
      Parameters:
      classification - The event classification (NEUTRAL, HOSTILE, etc.)
      eventName - The unique name for this event

    • BaseMobSpawn

      public BaseMobSpawn(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType defaultMobType, String eventName)
      Constructs a mob spawn event with a default mob type and name. The event is classified as NEUTRAL by default.
      Parameters:
      defaultMobType - The default entity type to spawn
      eventName - The unique name for this event

    • BaseMobSpawn

      public BaseMobSpawn(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType defaultMobType, EventClassification classification, String eventName)
      Constructs a mob spawn event with specified mob type, classification, and name.
      Parameters:
      defaultMobType - The default entity type to spawn
      classification - The event classification (NEUTRAL, HOSTILE, etc.)
      eventName - The unique name for this event

    • BaseMobSpawn

      public BaseMobSpawn(List<org.bukkit.entity.EntityType> mobTypes, EventClassification classification, String eventName)
      Constructs a mob spawn event with multiple mob types and specified classification. Enables random mob type selection by default.
      Parameters:
      mobTypes - List of entity types that can be spawned
      classification - The event classification (NEUTRAL, HOSTILE, etc.)
      eventName - The unique name for this event

  • Method Details

    • execute

      public void execute()
      Spawns mobs for all online players based on the current configuration. If continuous spawning is enabled, starts a repeating task. Otherwise, performs a single spawn cycle.
      Specified by:
      execute in class BaseEvent

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Terminates the event by stopping any continuous spawning tasks. Logs appropriate messages based on whether the event was using random mob types and whether the task was successfully stopped.
      Specified by:
      terminate in class BaseEvent

    • startContinuousTask

      public boolean startContinuousTask()
      Starts a continuous task that spawns mobs at regular intervals. The task runs every spawnInterval seconds.
      Returns:
      true if the task was successfully started, false if a task is already running

    • stopContinuousTask

      public boolean stopContinuousTask()
      Stops the continuous spawning task if one is running.
      Returns:
      true if a task was stopped, false if no task was running

    • onMobSpawned

      protected void onMobSpawned(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Hook method called when a mob is spawned. Can be overridden by child classes to implement custom behavior.
      Parameters:
      entity - The spawned entity
      player - The player for whom the mob was spawned

    • spawnForAllPlayers

      public int spawnForAllPlayers()
      Spawns mobs for all online players. Logs the spawn results for each player and calls onMobSpawned(org.bukkit.entity.Entity, org.bukkit.entity.Player) for each spawned entity.
      Returns:
      The total number of mobs spawned across all players

    • spawnForPlayer

      public List<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> spawnForPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Spawns mobs for a specific player based on configuration settings. Uses either group or spread spawning depending on useGroupSpawning.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to spawn mobs for
      Returns:
      List of spawned entities, or empty list if player is null or offline

    • spawnSpreadForPlayer

      public List<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> spawnSpreadForPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Spawns mobs spread out around a player within the configured radius. Each mob is spawned at a random location within the spawn radius, checking for safe locations before spawning.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to spawn mobs around
      Returns:
      List of successfully spawned entities

    • spawnGroupForPlayer

      public List<org.bukkit.entity.Entity> spawnGroupForPlayer(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Spawns a group of mobs near a player at a single central location. First finds a safe center point, then spawns mobs clustered around it within the groupSpacing radius.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to spawn the mob group near
      Returns:
      List of successfully spawned entities

    • markSpawnedMob

      public void markSpawnedMob(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Marks an entity as spawned by this event using persistent data. Used to track and manage spawned mobs.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to mark as spawned by this event

    • isSpawnedMobMarked

      public boolean isSpawnedMobMarked(org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Checks if an entity was spawned by this event.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity to check
      Returns:
      true if the entity was spawned by this event, false otherwise

    • killAllSpawnedMob

      public void killAllSpawnedMob()
      Removes all mobs that were spawned by this event across all worlds. Adds the event's key to the deletion list and removes marked entities.

    • addMobType

      public BaseMobSpawn addMobType(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Adds a new mob type to the list of possible spawn types. Does nothing if the type is null or already in the list.
      Parameters:
      entityType - The entity type to add
      Returns:
      This instance for method chaining

      entityTypes - List of entity types to add
      Returns:
      This instance for method chaining

    • removeMobType

      public BaseMobSpawn removeMobType(org.bukkit.entity.EntityType entityType)
      Removes a mob type from the list of possible spawn types. If the removed type is the current default, resets to a new default.
      Parameters:
      entityType - The entity type to remove
      Returns:
      This instance for method chaining

    • setMobTypes

      public BaseMobSpawn setMobTypes(List<org.bukkit.entity.EntityType> entityTypes)
      Replaces the current list of mob types with a new list. If the new list is null or empty, keeps the default mob type.
      Parameters:
      entityTypes - New list of entity types to use
      Returns:
      This instance for method chaining

    • clearMobTypes

      public BaseMobSpawn clearMobTypes()
      Clears all mob types except the current default type. Ensures at least one mob type remains available for spawning.
      Returns:
      This instance for method chaining

    • getRandomMobType

      protected org.bukkit.entity.EntityType getRandomMobType()
      Gets a random mob type from the available mob types list. Returns a random type only if random mob types are enabled and the list is not empty. Otherwise, returns the default mob type.
      Returns:
      The selected EntityType to spawn

    • getSafeLocation

      protected org.bukkit.Location getSafeLocation(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, int initialX, int initialY, int initialZ)
      Attempts to find a safe location to spawn a mob near the given coordinates. Makes multiple attempts to find a valid location within spawn radius and height limits. Adjusts position based on terrain and safety checks.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to spawn near
      initialX - Initial X coordinate
      initialY - Initial Y coordinate
      initialZ - Initial Z coordinate
      Returns:
      A safe Location for spawning, or null if none found

    • getGroupSafeLocation

      protected org.bukkit.Location getGroupSafeLocation(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, org.bukkit.Location groupCenter, int initialX, int initialY, int initialZ)
      Attempts to find a safe location to spawn a mob within a group. Similar to getSafeLocation but maintains proximity to group center.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to spawn near
      groupCenter - The central location of the group
      initialX - Initial X coordinate
      initialY - Initial Y coordinate
      initialZ - Initial Z coordinate
      Returns:
      A safe Location for spawning within group bounds, or null if none found

    • getLastSpawnCount

      public int getLastSpawnCount()
      Gets the number of mobs spawned in the last execution.
      Returns:
      The count of mobs spawned in the most recent spawn operation

      public List<org.bukkit.entity.EntityType> getMobTypes()
      Gets an unmodifiable list of all possible mob types that can be spawned.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable List of EntityTypes that can be spawned
